title: Way back when, the only way you would’ve found out about a regional recipe like Chicken Riggies, would have been to eat it while traveling through Central New York.
directions: Way back when, the only way you would’ve found out about a regional recipe like Chicken Riggies, would have been to eat it while traveling through Central New York.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs, roughly chopped or cubed
1 (28-oz) can whole, peeled San Marzano tomatoes, crushed
1 1/2 cups chopped hot and/or sweet peppers (any jarred or fresh peppers will work, but cherry peppers are a good choice)
*if using mild peppers, use chili flakes or chili paste to increase the spiciness.
1/2 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano or Romano cheese
